name: McAfee's Knob
description: With its stunning, 270-degree panoramic views of the surrounding valley and mountains, along with its signature ledge that has become a popular place for photos, McAfee Knob should be included in any trip that includes hiking in Virginia's Blue Ridge.

name: Dragon's Tooth
description: Dragon's Tooth is a unique rock formation that rises dramatically from the Appalachian Trail. Its jagged, tooth-like appearance gives the trail its name and provides hikers with an exhilarating destination at the end of their journey.

name: Tinker Cliffs
description: The cliffs offer 180-degree panoramic views and a hiking experience that will leave you in awe. In addition to the gorgeous views at the summit, the hike along the way will lead you past unique rock formations, wildflowers, rushing streams, and lush forests.

name: Haystack Rock
description: The cliffs offer 180-degree panoramic views and a hiking experience that will leave you in awe. In addition to the gorgeous views at the summit, the hike along the way will lead you past unique rock formations, wildflowers, rushing streams, and lush forests.

name: Hoop Hole
description: Whether you're a beginner looking to hone your skills or a seasoned rider craving adrenaline-pumping descents, Hoop Hole promises an unforgettable biking experience amidst Virginia's natural beauty.

name: Sharp Top
description: The Sharp Top Mountain trail is a popular, 3-mile roundtrip hike in the Peaks of Otter area of Virginia, known for its strenuous climb to a summit with 360-degree views, and includes sections of stairs and rockier terrain

name: Buffalo Mountain
description: Buffalo Mountain, part of the Buffalo Mountain Natural Area Preserve, features a unique ecosystem with sub-alpine vegetation, magnesium-rich soils, and windswept balds, accessible via a steep, moderately graded one-mile trail leading to a peak of 3,971 feet

name: Murray Run Greenway
description: The Murray Run Greenway is a 1.9-mile neighborhood trail in Roanoke, VA, connecting five schools and three parks, featuring a cinder surface trail, commemorative trees, and a bridge with views of a rain garden.

name: Roaring Run
description: Roaring Run is a popular get-away for escaping the summer heat. It features shady picnic spots, a native trout stream and a 1 Â½ -mile scenic loop trail that follows Roaring Run Creek to a cascading waterfall.

name: Pandapas Pond
description: Pandapas Pond offers an 8-acre manmade pond that provides fishing, hiking, flat-water canoeing, and picnicking opportunities. A 1-mile loop trail, at an approximate elevation of 2200 feet, circles the lake and meanders through the surrounding Appalachian hardwoods and pines and some rhododendron thickets.

name: The Cascades
description: The Cascades Trail, a 4-mile loop trail in Pembroke, Virginia, leads to the 66-foot Cascades Falls, offering scenic views of Little Stony Creek and a mix of rocky and easier terrain with stone steps, walls, and bridges.

name: Devils Marbleyard
description: The Devil's Marbleyard hike, a 3.3-mile out-and-back trail in the James River Face Wilderness, features a large boulder field and is considered challenging, offering rock scrambling and views.

name: The Roanoke Star Trail
description: The Star Trail in Roanoke, Virginia, is a popular 1.7-mile hiking trail that climbs Mill Mountain, offering breathtaking views of the city and the Blue Ridge Mountains, and culminates at the iconic Roanoke Star.

name: Chestnut Loop Trail
description: The Chestnut Ridge Trail, a 5.4-mile loop, is an easy-to-moderate hike through a shaded forest, offering a serene atmosphere and views of the Blue Ridge Parkway
